Df5EF5Xp2UJLcuBf.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[4d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[5d6[poison]], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} , and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[6d6[poison]], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} , and enfeebled 2 (1 round)
Df5EF5Xp2UJLcuBf.name: Karumzek Venom

LacGOd6744WQoep2.description: A karumzek senses any poisoned creature. It can spend an action with the concentrate trait to determine the poison's type and current stage.
LacGOd6744WQoep2.name: Poison Sense (precise) 30 feet

wkx0zg9p09ltwahi.description: Each enemy in the karumzek swarm's space takes @Damage[2d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:27|basic:true] save) plus karumzek venom.
wkx0zg9p09ltwahi.name: Swarming Bites

Khefak Scuttler.description:
These small creatures are ubiquitous vermin found across much of Akiton.

This unusual arthropod resembles an amalgam of a centipede and a crab. Hard-shelled and perfectly suited to life on Akiton, khefaks are so incredibly useful that a visitor to the planet might assume they were custom engineered for their environs. Such visitors would, in fact, be correct. While khefaks can be found naturally on Akiton, a new species has recently gained a foothold on the planet: alchemically engineered khefaks who excrete a refined substance that can be used as fuel to power advanced engines and devices.

s3dgrtwo12cpa77n.description: A khefak can gain nourishment by eating objects with hardness 10 or lower. When attacking an object with its mandibles, it ignores the first 10 points of that object's Hardness.
s3dgrtwo12cpa77n.name: Consume Objects

Khefak Scuttler.name: Khefak Scuttler

7bsb9tpgqx3nzgqd.description:
60 feet. A creature that enters the emanation or starts its turn within it tumbles down a deep well of dread and must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:33] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it's no longer frightened.
7bsb9tpgqx3nzgqd.name: Despairing Presence

mq9s4yu5bx9phcyh.description: The kilia mwibo feeds on the negative emotions of a creature within 60 feet; this must be a creature that it can precisely sense with its emotion sense. The target must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:36] save or increase its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained} condition value by 1 (by 2 on a critical failure), to a maximum of drained 4.
mq9s4yu5bx9phcyh.name: Consume Emotion

tzhwamd48xkcm2zr.description: A kilia mwibo can sense nearby negative emotions. This is a precise sense against creatures who are under powerful emotion effects like rage, those who are frightened, or, at the GM's discretion, those who are in the grips of hatred, sadness, or other overwhelming negative emotions. Against all other creatures that possess emotions, this is an imprecise sense. A creature that has no emotions is effectively @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} to a kilia mwibo. A creature that knows about emotion sense can take precautions to Hide and Sneak from a kilia mwibo, in this case by suppressing feelings of negativity.
tzhwamd48xkcm2zr.name: Emotion Sense 60 feet

5JX01w5MibVwU0QO.description:
When the King of Biting Ants is reduced to 0 HP, he discorporates, and the component ants that make up his body disperse in every direction. If even a single ant escapes, the King of Biting Ants will eventually re-form using a process that typically takes [[/br 1d10 #Re-Form]]{1d10 days}.

Applying area damage immediately after the King of Biting Ants is killed prevents his return.
5JX01w5MibVwU0QO.name: Discorporate

6bjKSQ8MAofZ2xOn.description:
The King of Biting Ants Strides to a creature, ends his movement sharing a space with it, and deals @Damage[3d8[piercing],3d8[poison]]{3d8 piercing damage and 3d8 poison damage} to it (@Check[type:reflex|dc:39|basic:true] save).

A creature that fails this save also takes @Damage[2d8[persistent,piercing]] damage.
6bjKSQ8MAofZ2xOn.name: Squirming Embrace

JZuPbTeaLBAjYtoK.description:
The King of Biting Ants collapses into a shapeless swarm of ants. He drops all held, worn, and carried items.

While discorporated, The King of Biting Ants can't use attack actions and can't cast spells, but he can move through areas small enough for his individual ants to fit without having to Squeeze. He can use the same action to coalesce back into his normal form.
JZuPbTeaLBAjYtoK.name: Swarm Shape

MDnSjLK9lha3QgCV.description: You shroud a creature or object in wards that hide its alignment. The target appears to be neutral to all effects that would detect its alignment.
MDnSjLK9lha3QgCV.name: Undetectable Alignment

MWBo6s4COXrr6url.description:
You disguise the targets as other creatures of the same body shape and roughly similar height (within 6 inches) and weight (within 50 pounds). The disguise can hide the targets' identities or let them appear to be of another ancestry, but it's not precise enough to impersonate specific individuals. The spell doesn't change voice, scent, or mannerisms. You choose the disguise for each target; for example, you could make one target appear to be a dwarf and another an elf. Casting veil counts as setting up a disguise for the purpose of the Impersonate action. It allows the target to ignore any circumstance penalties they might take for being disguised as dissimilar creatures, and it gives the targets a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to prevent others from seeing through their disguises, and add their level even if untrained. You can Dismiss any or all of these disguises.

Heightened (5th) The spell also disguises the targets' voices and scents; it gains the auditory and olfactory traits.

Heightened (7th) The targets can appear as any creature of the same size, even specific individuals. You must have seen an individual to reproduce their appearance. The spell also disguises the targets' voices and scents; it gains the auditory and olfactory traits.
MWBo6s4COXrr6url.name: Veil

b1sqlxi68h8dr255.description:
While a creature is taking persistent piercing damage from the King of Biting Ants's tendril Strike or Squirming Embrace, or while within a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jBGAYmR0BkkbpJvG]{Visions of Danger} area that it has not disbelieved, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}.

If the creature attempts a concentrate or manipulate action while affected, it must succeed at a @Check[type:flat|dc:5] or the action is lost; roll the check after spending the action, but before any effects are applied.
b1sqlxi68h8dr255.name: Swarming Bites

c7GNehP7j1Jev7yW.description:
This wand features a carved dragon's head at its top and a polished metal sphere set in its midsection.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency Once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} at 7th rank.

After you cast the spell, an additional missile or missiles are released from the wand at the start of each of your turns, as though you cast the 1-action version of magic missile. Choose targets each time. This lasts for 1 minute, until you're no longer wielding the wand, or until you try to activate the wand again.

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of magic missile of the appropriate rank.
c7GNehP7j1Jev7yW.name: Wand of Manifold Missiles (7th-Level Spell)

djbe4fw534jra7zs.description:
Trigger A creature Casts a Spell the King of Biting Ants knows

Effect The King of Biting Ants expends a spell slot to counter the triggering creature's casting. The King of Biting Ants loses his spell slot as if he had cast the triggering spell. He then attempts to counteract the triggering spell.
djbe4fw534jra7zs.name: Counterspell

CWjX7fPDsslrImWC.description:
You need thieves' tools to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types) using the Thievery skill.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Sw7MBLASN3xK4Y44]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action.
CWjX7fPDsslrImWC.name: Thieves' Tools

NpTK4L9yg6CR90qn.description: Kiru deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

ef4e0z2ye2fe1mqw.description: Creatures hit by Kiru's dagger Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20|traits:agile,versatile-s,damaging-effect]{Fortitude (Strike was a Success)}@Check[type:fortitude|dc:25|traits:agile,versatile-s,damaging-effect]{Fortitude (Strike was a Critical Success)} save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure).
ef4e0z2ye2fe1mqw.name: Knife Jab

xx9wx5cf43c7dj2f.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Kiru.
xx9wx5cf43c7dj2f.name: Surprise Attack

3oREalAu2O4Q8VKb.description: Kolbo deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

8gJdTcNpHoqicL23.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

ANT5mE9LixWbnRu8.description:
Activate A Interact

Elixirs of life accelerate a living creatures natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain [[/r (3d6+6)[healing]]]{3d6+6 Hit Points} and gain +1 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.EpB7yJPEuG6ez4z3]{Effect: Elixir of Life (Lesser)}

Y23Rp7TqCHcfNswW.description:
You need thieves' tools to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types) using the Thievery skill.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Sw7MBLASN3xK4Y44]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action.
Y23Rp7TqCHcfNswW.name: Thieves' Tools

g09etgdswfk3cmam.description: If Kolbo is aware of his opponents and isn't prevented from speaking, he rolls Deception for initiative.
g09etgdswfk3cmam.name: A Quick Word

oyhny9m1cf1jxs02.description:
Requirements Kolbo successfully Feints an opponent

Effect The foe is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
oyhny9m1cf1jxs02.name: Low Blow

x55nzdlg9e8ekng0.description: Kolbo isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to creatures of 6th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking, or using surprise attack.
x55nzdlg9e8ekng0.name: Deny Advantage

5lcs65dfdhlor6lz.description: Kreekoss can Fly at half Speed while he has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in his talons, carrying that creature along with it.
5lcs65dfdhlor6lz.name: Snatch

6ch2viu3a2726ydv.description: Kreekoss Flies up to double his fly Speed in a straight line, descending at least 10 feet, and then makes a talon Strike.
6ch2viu3a2726ydv.name: Eagle Dive

87ccotkcz9flzb2j.description: When Kreekoss rolls a success on a Reflex save, he gets a critical success instead.
87ccotkcz9flzb2j.name: Evasion

Tlu3XGrGCiB1lklW.description: When attacking with a finesse melee weapon, Kurshkin adds her Dexterity modifier to damage rolls instead of her Strength modifier.
Tlu3XGrGCiB1lklW.name: Natural Thief

V91wrEHb3gd1ahCH.description:
20 feet. Creatures other than animals, gremlins, and gnolls in the aura become extremely unlucky (@Check[type:will|dc:20] save; creature must roll this Will save twice and take the worse result). On a successful save, the creature is temporarily immune to pugwampi unluck auras for 24 hours. On a failure, the creature must roll twice and take the worse result on all checks as long as it is within the aura.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.yxgHWK2rTZKKAzDN]{Effect: Unluck Aura}
V91wrEHb3gd1ahCH.name: Unluck Aura

eylSqlpR88uP4QNV.description: Kurshkin deals an additional [[/r {1d6}]]{1d6 damage} with her melee Strikes against creatures affected by her unluck aura.
eylSqlpR88uP4QNV.name: Lucky Stabs

ryDsOG2FBjVYANrF.description:
Trigger A Strike critically misses Kurshkin

Effect Kurshkin redirects the strike to an adjacent creature. The attacker rerolls the Strike against that creature.
ryDsOG2FBjVYANrF.name: Collateral Damage

broizkqu57k2yok4.description: The golem repairs itself, regaining [[/br 30[healing]]]{30 Hit Points}.
broizkqu57k2yok4.name: Self-Repair

ggjs0w79v0sr9ab8.description: On a critical hit, the golem's staff Strike breaks the target's armor, if any, in addition to dealing damage to the target. If the target has a shield raised, the golem breaks the shield instead.
ggjs0w79v0sr9ab8.name: Destructive Strike

iOkGanVQLy28fFnI.description:
harmed by acid ([[/r {9d10}]]{9d10 damage}, [[/r {2d10}]]{2d10 damage} from areas or persistent damage); healed by plant (area [[/r 2d10[healing]]] Hit Points); slowed by electricity

A golem is immune to spells and magical abilities other than its own, but each type of golem is affected by a few types of magic in special ways. These exceptions are listed in shortened form in the golem's stat block, with the full rules appearing here. If an entry lists multiple types (such as "cold and water"), either type of spell can affect the golem.

  • Harmed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to take the listed amount of damage (this damage has no type) instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of magic of this type or is affected by a persistent effect of the appropriate type, it takes the damage listed in the parenthetical.
  • Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical.
  • Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/br 2d6 #rounds]]{2d6 rounds} instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it's slowed 1 for that round.
  • Vulnerable To Each golem is vulnerable to one or more specific spells, with the effects described in its stat block.
iOkGanVQLy28fFnI.name: Golem Antimagic

j9c0igc036qj9m4s.description:
The golem Strides up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can try to bar the way by attempting a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:43] save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage and its armor takes no damage.

Success The golem halts its movement and cannot enter the creature's square.

Failure The resisting creature is damaged and its armor takes damage as if hit by the golem's staff.
j9c0igc036qj9m4s.name: Inexorable March

l3ib5p5v8pohydvm.description: The golem vents a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of fiery splinters from its internal forge. This deals @Damage[13d6[piercing]] damage to all creatures in the cone (@Check[type:reflex|dc:38|basic:true]). Creatures who fail the save also take @Damage[2d6[persistent,fire]] damage (@Damage[4d6[persistent,fire]] damage on a critical failure). The golem can't use Vent Splinters again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Vent Splinters]]{1d4 rounds}.
l3ib5p5v8pohydvm.name: Vent Splinters

pjjx4azz3gsp6vh0.description: When the golem is at 0 HP, it isn't destroyed. Instead, it enters repair mode, during which it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}, can't take reactions, and can take only the Self-Repair action. Once it has more than 30 HP, it can use any type of action and can use reactions, though it remains slowed 1 and can't take any reactions until the start of its next turn. If a critical hit with an adamantine weapon reduces the golem to 0 HP, or if such a weapon hits it while it's already at 0 HP, then the golem is destroyed.
pjjx4azz3gsp6vh0.name: Repair Mode

t0rg3oycgmd415fs.description: The golem can be targeted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ihbRf964JDXztcy3]{Disjunction}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.CXICME10TkEJxz0P]{Shape Wood}. If targeted by such a spell of 9th rank or higher, the golem has its resistance to physical damage lowered to 10 and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} if in repair mode) for [[/r 1d4 #Golem Vulnerability]]{1d4 rounds}. During this time, if the golem is reduced to 0 HP while already in repair mode, it is destroyed.
t0rg3oycgmd415fs.name: Vulnerable to Dispelling and Shape Wood

5fuz5dej9owm5ap2.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet of the sun-spire begins to Cast a Spell that has the fire or light trait

Effect The sun-spire attempts to redirect the energy from the triggering effect into its sunlight stores. The sun-spire attempts to counteract the triggering spell with a [[/r {1d20+22} #counteract]]{+22} counteract bonus. If it successfully counteracts the spell, the sun-spire's sunlight stores are empowered. While empowered, the sun-spire deals an additional @Damage[2d8[fire]] damage with all of its attacks and abilities. The sun-spire remains empowered until the end of its next turn.
5fuz5dej9owm5ap2.name: Steal the Sun

aafpuxt66c9n4wag.description: The sun-spire collects solar energy and uses the energy to create a deadly beam of fire. It fires the beam in a @Template[type:line|distance:120], dealing @Damage[11d8[fire]] damage to all creatures in the line (@Check[type:reflex|dc:33|basic:true] save). The concentrated beam ignites everything in its path, including the air, creating a wall of burning flame along the line that continues to burn until the end of the sun-spire's next turn. This wall has the effects of a 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IarZrgCeaiUqOuRu]{Wall of Fire} spell, dealing @Damage[5d6[fire]] damage to any creature that crosses the wall or occupies the wall's area at the start of its turn. The sun-spire can't use the Beam of the Seven Suns again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, although rounds it's not in sunlight don't count toward this number.
aafpuxt66c9n4wag.name: Beam of the Seven Suns

cayZLGHrwDiRg60D.description:
Like normal objects, the Living Sun-Spire has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once the statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 32.
cayZLGHrwDiRg60D.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 14)

9t3xrtta75c0eu2d.description: Loakan can hold her breath for 200 rounds (20 minutes).
9t3xrtta75c0eu2d.name: Deep Breath

f5ywcwye6st78fb5.description: Loakan makes a greatclub Strike and two tail Strikes against the same creature. If the greatclub Strike hits, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against both tail Strikes.
f5ywcwye6st78fb5.name: Battering Tail

4a5zpaem8fwltsc9.description:
Trigger Mashkudu Shoves, Trips, or Disarms a creature

Effect Mashkudu attempts a Thievery check to Steal an object the target carries.
4a5zpaem8fwltsc9.name: Opportunistic Maneuver

70izbkhmlirktufl.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Mashkudu.
70izbkhmlirktufl.name: Surprise Attack

gUg2sTdfXVUKSjHl.description: Mashkudu deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

o3GtHshy4S9As4As.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

yVtqtcflhBt9ad0V.description:
You need thieves' tools to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types) using the Thievery skill.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Sw7MBLASN3xK4Y44]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action.
yVtqtcflhBt9ad0V.name: Thieves' Tools

Mpeshi.description:
In the heights of the world, where the hills and mountains reach up to touch the clouds, mpeshis fall to the earth in flashes of lightning and thunder. Most return to the heavens on the gossamer strands of web on which they descend, but those few that remain cry out, lamenting their inability to return to their homes in the sky.

A mpeshi appears to be a monstrous goat with the foreclaws, hindquarters, and tail of a crocodile. Electricity arcs around its sharp horns, which it can use to both batter and gore with equal facility. Although mpeshis are always seeking methods to return to their homes in the clouds, they aggressively defend their earthbound lairs from outsiders.

Mpeshis are generally solitary, though some congregate as pairs or small groups that watch cloud movements together. They can sometimes be seen trying to join reach the storm clouds, leaping from high places such as hills, mountains, or cliffs. Though these attempts are rarely successful, the mpeshis always resolve to try again-and some do manage succeed at returning to their mysterious homes amongst the clouds.

Mpeshis are utterly unafraid of rocs, dragons, or other monstrous flying creatures, usually seeing them as competition. Mpeshis are crafty, though, and sometimes try to negotiate transportation back to the clouds from flying creatures larger than they are.

amdbahvl6eictspf.description:
Trigger The mpeshi falls at least 10 feet

Effect The mpeshi reorients itself to slam headfirst into the ground with a thundering crash. Creatures within 10 feet of the mpeshi take sonic damage equal to the bludgeoning damage the mpeshi took from the fall (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:23|basic:true|traits:sonic,rare,beast] save). Creatures that fail this save are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} on a critical failure).
amdbahvl6eictspf.name: Thunderous Fall

g9wmcilhs6jr9xln.description: The mpeshi can tread on clouds or fog as though on solid ground.
g9wmcilhs6jr9xln.name: Cloud Walk

h9g99u8hu6fx5pgu.description: 5 feet. A buzzing static electricity surrounds the mpeshi. When a creature within the aura takes electricity damage, the damage arcs to a random adjacent creature, dealing @Damage[1d6[electricity]] damage. A creature can only receive arcing damage once from each attack or effect.
h9g99u8hu6fx5pgu.name: Lightning Aura

ysjstn1162a1nei5.description: The mpeshi leaps up to 40 feet in any direction, including straight up. The mpeshi makes a horn Strike at any point during this leap.
ysjstn1162a1nei5.name: Charging Leap

Mpeshi.name: Mpeshi

616mif12ligvnmwx.description:
Frequency Until recharged

Effect Warder-Chief Mpondo Casts a Spell that takes 1 or 2 actions to cast and requires a spell attack roll. The effects of the spell do not occur immediately but are imbued into the attack instead. Mpondo makes a melee Strike. The spell is coupled with the attack, using the attack roll result to determine the effects of both the Strike and the spell.

This counts as two attacks for Mpondo's multiple attack penalty, but don't apply the penalty until after he has completed the Spellstrike.

After Mpondo uses Spellstrike, he can't do so again until he recharges his Spellstrike as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. Mpondo also recharges his Spellstrike when he casts a conflux spell.
616mif12ligvnmwx.name: Spellstrike

9h2x9m57ybtc0het.description:
Warder-Chief Mpondo can see @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} creatures and objects as though they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}.

When he @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seeks} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1xRFPTFtWtGJ9ELw]{Senses Motive}, he can roll twice and take the higher result.
9h2x9m57ybtc0het.name: Iobane Vision

QSIWlBBGbqY7Nco9.description: When sounded, a signal horn can be heard clearly up to half a mile away across open terrain.
QSIWlBBGbqY7Nco9.name: Signal Horn

k9acwRapLvdAloPJ.description: This broad-bladed sword, sometimes called the hand-and-a-half sword, has a longer grip so it can be held in one hand or used with two hands to provide extra piercing or slashing power.

ykrmBuObzj5cvS8Y.description:
Dragonhide shields are each immune to one damage type based on the type of dragon.

Dragon Type Immunity
Black or copper acid
Blue or bronze electricity
Brass, Red, or Gold fire
Green poison
Silver or white cold

The shield has Hardness 5, HP 20, and BT 10.

Craft Requirements dragonhide worth at least 4,000 gp
ykrmBuObzj5cvS8Y.name: Black Dragonhide Buckler (High-Grade)

7ga2khcvv6lq3yxy.description: 30 feet. A creature that enters the area must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). A creature taking persistent acid damage from the ooze's pseudopod can't recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.
7ga2khcvv6lq3yxy.name: Noxious Scent

ddyqm7rf1ighrfxe.description: A sewer ooze can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movements.
ddyqm7rf1ighrfxe.name: Motion Sense 60 feet

fbv6ilmjn1jfhgbt.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The sewer ooze unleashes a wave of filth, covering all creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20]. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:24|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d4[acid]] damage and a -10-foot penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute (on a critical failure, the creature also falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}). A creature can spend an Interact action to clean someone off, decreasing the Speed penalty by 5 feet with each action.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Qomp2EujVCbzJb4X]{Effect: Filth Wave}
fbv6ilmjn1jfhgbt.name: Filth Wave

Nairu.description:
Assassins commit murder, either for pay or due to their belief in a cause, such as a religion or a political movement. Some assassins work alone and choose their own victims. Others are members of assassins' guilds, organizations that accept contracts to kill in return for money, favors, or both.

Some criminals are the desperate who have no option but to break the law to survive, while others choose a life of crime for thrills, forming gangs or underworld guilds that specialize in certain illegal ventures.

2w1WQr635JVnsORb.description: Nairu can move their full speed when @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneaking}.
2w1WQr635JVnsORb.name: Swift Sneak

OcIjdwf9GNebW25K.description:
Giant centipede venom causes severe muscle stiffness.

Activate 2 Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw DC 17 Fortitude

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d12[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and off-guard (1 round)

UwN0QpM1415fv6O1.description: An invisibility potion is colorless and oddly lightweight. Upon drinking it, you gain the effects of a 2nd-rank invisibility spell.

cYpzRpaINHeW2XxC.description:

Effect Nairu applied a poison to the weapon.
cYpzRpaINHeW2XxC.name: Poison Weapon

Activate 1 Interact

After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in darkness. You gain darkvision for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.7UL8belWmo7U5YGM]{Effect: Darkvision Elixir (Lesser)}

zeH3OrBLioIRoYb5.description: Nairu isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to creatures of 8th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.w6rMqmGzhUahdnA7]{Surprise Attack}.

Nairu.name: Nairu

3b5ryi2mtgy8eg1h.description: Nkiruka attempts a @Check[type:perception] check against the Deception DC or Will DC, whichever is higher, of a creature she can see. On a success, she gleans a notable detail about the creature as if she had successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recalled Knowledge} about it. Once Nkiruka has Sized Up a creature, she can't do so again for 1 day.
3b5ryi2mtgy8eg1h.name: Size Up

LSb7bSeQRrEh2eyF.description: +29 to notice lies and Sense Motive
LSb7bSeQRrEh2eyF.name: +4 to Notice Lies or Sense Motive

pst9oigxxhqbv2nz.description: When Nkiruka Makes an Impression, she can compare her Diplomacy check result to the Will DCs of up to four targets instead of one.
pst9oigxxhqbv2nz.name: Group Impression

vfxgkirg3wl676h4.description: Nkiruka's Strikes against creatures she observes that don't have cover and aren't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} deal an additional 2d10 precision damage.
vfxgkirg3wl676h4.name: Eye for an Opening

zm7h079en49435hi.description: Nkiruka's training allows her to recognize microexpressions, voice tone, and other tells. When a creature fails to Lie to Nkiruka, not only does she know they were lying, she also receives a clue about what that creature believes to be the truth.
zm7h079en49435hi.name: Ear for Lies

854bcge93kw67a9p.description: When the Norgorberite spy successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feints} a creature, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the spy's ranged attacks as well as melee attacks.

Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.
RiNPvLupxrWIFxSL.name: Religious Symbol of Norgorber (Wooden)

aLhg6IhcRwMgKtGn.description: The Norgorberite spy deals an additional 4d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures or creatures within reach of at least two of their allies.

mCdreQ5XkW5nSJhP.description:
Activate A Interact

Your mind becomes clear and cognition flows freely, but physical matters seem ephemeral.

Benefit You gain a +3 item bonus to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks and all checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge}. Your critical failures on @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} checks become failures instead. You become trained in one Intelligence-based skill [Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, Society], chosen at creation.

Drawback You take a -2 penalty to weapon and unarmed attack rolls, Athletics checks, and acrobatics checks. You can carry 2 less Bulk than normal before becoming encumbered, and the maximum Bulk you can carry is reduced by 4.

Duration 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.qit1mLbJUyRTYcPU]{Effect: Cognitive Mutagen (Greater)}

s8925ad90z8czuya.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the Norgorberite spy.
s8925ad90z8czuya.name: Surprise Attack

su8sm4dwugl8vk8q.description: The Norgorberite spy Interacts to draw a weapon, then Strikes with that weapon.

tp0wkvck5vm09z96.description:
Trigger The spy is about to attempt a saving throw

Effect The spy touches their religious symbol of Norgorber and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to the triggering save.
tp0wkvck5vm09z96.name: Reaper's Protection

ukJ5Ckvj2jm5mRRq.description:
Slumber wine sees its greatest use in games of intrigue, where an absence can be more devastating than injury. Characters unconscious from slumber wine can't wake up by any means while the poison lasts, don't need to eat or drink while unconscious in this way, and appear to be recently dead unless an examiner succeeds at a @Check[type:medicine|dc:40|name:Identify Slumber Wine] check.

Activate A Interact (Ingested)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32]

Onset 1 hour

Maximum Duration 7 days

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} (1 day)

Stage 2 unconscious (2 days)

Stage 3 unconscious (3 days)

eb08k6r7dwsmypra.description:
Requirements Old Thrasher must have a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect Old Thrasher tucks its legs and rolls rapidly, twisting its victim. It makes a jaws Strike with a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll against the grabbed creature. If it hits, it also knocks the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If it fails, it releases the creature.
eb08k6r7dwsmypra.name: Death Roll

kqwu7xlfj3pscfmw.description:
Requirements Old Thrasher must have a creature grabbed

Effect Old Thrasher Swims, bringing its victim along with it.
kqwu7xlfj3pscfmw.name: Into the Deep

qf09eu3mnq3exeor.description: Old Thrasher can hold its breath for about 4 hours.
qf09eu3mnq3exeor.name: Deep Breath

wqv2jc5np1swyru2.description: Old Thrasher makes up to three tail Strikes against different targets. Any target hit must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25|traits:animal]{Fortitude (success)} (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:30|traits:animal]{Fortitude (critical success)}) save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
wqv2jc5np1swyru2.name: Thunderous Tail

93mg0jw3efbc6prt.description:
Frequency twice per day

Effect Onyiji casts a spell and couples it with a staff Strike. She casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.O9w7r4BKgPogYDDe]{Produce Flame}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gYjPm7YwGtEa1oxh]{Ray of Frost}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r3NeUnsgt9mS03Sn]{Shocking Grasp}, but the effects don't occur immediately. She makes a melee Strike with her staff and uses the attack roll result as the effect of both the Strike and the spell.

This counts as two attacks towards her multiple attack penalty, but the penalties don't apply until after the Spellstrike.
93mg0jw3efbc6prt.name: Spellstrike

ayacm2lkwvhcnv2z.description:
When Onyiji wields a staff in one hand, it gains the agile trait and its damage die size increases to d6 (these adjustments are reflected in the Strike above). When she wields a staff in two hands, it gains the parry, reach, and trip traits.

She can Interact to Release or change her grip on her staff as a free action when she Strikes with the staff (including Strikes made in a Spellstrike).
ayacm2lkwvhcnv2z.name: Twisting Tree

q3iiuioxoja6dk4q.description:
Trigger Onyiji is about to make a saving throw against a spell or magical effect

Effect Onyiji gains a +1 circumstance bonus to the triggering save.
q3iiuioxoja6dk4q.name: Orc Superstition

Pugwampi (SoT).description:
Mean, dog-faced, and craven, pugwampis take disproportionate enjoyment from the accidents and missteps of other creatures-something that happens often due to the supernatural aura of ill fortune these gremlins project. They enjoy preparing pranks involving spikes, excrement, pits full of spiders, and the like. Pugwampis are somewhat deaf and thus often yell loudly to each other when not hiding. Many pugwampis worship gnolls as gods and aspire to be more like gnolls, although gnolls hate pugwampis even more than most creatures do, due to their sycophantic fawning.

Gremlins are cruel fey tricksters and saboteurs who have fully acclimated to life on the Material Plane, finding distinct niches for their inventive destructiveness. All gremlins delight in ruining or breaking things, whether it's something physical like a device or vehicle or something intangible such as an alliance or relationship. A gremlin's greatest joy is watching the collapse of complex creations, preferably after the lightest and slightest, carefully targeted push from the gremlin. Gremlins tend to denigrate, bully, or even slaughter their lesser kin, particularly mitflits, whom gremlins (and many others) derisively call "mites."

AGjtcz0cAWzBXlEx.description:
20 feet. Creatures other than animals, gremlins, and gnolls in the aura become extremely unlucky (@Check[type:will|dc:16] save; creature must roll this Will save twice and take the worse result). On a successful save, the creature is temporarily immune to pugwampi unluck auras for 24 hours. On a failure, the creature must roll twice and take the worse result on all checks as long as it is within the aura.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.yxgHWK2rTZKKAzDN]{Effect: Unluck Aura}
AGjtcz0cAWzBXlEx.name: Unluck Aura

Pugwampi (SoT).name: Pugwampi (SoT)

Ravager Of Tindalos.description:
Lean and athirst, the hounds of Tindalos are drawn to those who tamper with the flow of time, travel through time, or use magic or rare alchemical drugs to send their thoughts or perception back or forward in time. Powerful spellcasters can draw them from the Dimension of Time via rare rituals, but doing so attracts the hounds' ire, so few who traffic in such rituals live long enough to spread their knowledge. While the hounds possess great cunning and cruel intellect, they rarely interact with other creatures-other than to hunt and destroy those who have attracted their unblinking attention.

Once a hound catches scent of a mortal to hunt, it calls others of its ilk. The pack then pursues its victim through all space and time until it catches, slays and devours them. Those pursued can escape only by avoiding all angles, as hounds of Tindalos could step through them from nothingness at any time.

1IvCoMHs0qGTlw8J.description:
30 feet. The ravager of Tindalos's eyes glow balefully, causing painful but bloodless wounds to rip open in the body of a creature that meets its awful gaze. When a creature ends its turn in the aura's emanation, it takes @Damage[9d6[slashing]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:37|basic:true] save).

A creature that critically succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 24 hours.
1IvCoMHs0qGTlw8J.name: Ripping Gaze

QdL56xftSIj5zH9H.description:
The ravager of Tindalos makes three Strikes with its jaws attack. Each Strike must be against a different opponent within its reach.

Each attack counts toward the ravager's multiple attack penalty, but does not increase its penalty until it has made all the attacks.
QdL56xftSIj5zH9H.name: Ferocious Bites

kuV1kCq4ZEiH9DzH.description:
When a ravager of Tindalos is not adjacent to a structural angle of 90º (or more acute), its resistance to physical damage is suppressed and it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. It can't recover from this sickened condition, but the condition ends automatically once the ravager is again adjacent to a suitable angle.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.V60TWjo1G1r5ZtPM]{Effect: Vulnerable to Curved Space}
kuV1kCq4ZEiH9DzH.name: Vulnerable to Curved Space

u6tuxFGclP3Cf3u2.description:
Whenever a creature targets the ravager of Tindalos with a mental effect, that creature takes @Damage[9d6[mental]] damage (@Check[type:will|dc:40|basic:true] save).

On a critical failure, it also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute.
u6tuxFGclP3Cf3u2.name: Otherworldly Mind

xq3V1P1OXiEGcqZs.description:
The ravager of Tindalos casts a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate} spell, but it must transport itself into a space adjacent to an angle of 90º (or more acute) in the structure or environment around it. For example, it could teleport to a space adjacent to a wall (using the angle between the wall and floor) or a corner in a room, or adjacent to a sizable tree growing straight up out of the ground, but not to a flat plain or a room with only curved corners and edges.

Once per day, the ravager can use this ability to plane shift to or from the Dimension of Time, with the same restrictions on what angles it can appear next to.
xq3V1P1OXiEGcqZs.name: Angled Entry

Ravager Of Tindalos.name: Ravager Of Tindalos

IgxbUF7KM3R2U5pt.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.
IgxbUF7KM3R2U5pt.name: Religious Symbol of Walkena

Xoa0KLxTvGaKuPij.description: The sun hunter's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

a96pdh6130w53g5a.description:
The sun hunter reads a creature they can see within 30 feet to notice openings. The sun hunter attempts a Perception check against that creature's Deception DC or Will DC, whichever is higher. The target is then temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Critical Success The sun hunter reads the target like a book. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the sun hunter's attacks until the end of the sun hunter's next turn.

Success The sun hunter notices a brief opening. The target is off-guard against the sun hunter's attacks until the end of the sun hunter's turn.

Failure The target is unaffected.

Critical Failure The sun hunter's intense focus opens them up to other attacks. The target is unaffected, and the sun hunter is off-guard until the start of their next turn.
a96pdh6130w53g5a.name: Study Foe

orBkSImTP2bkbSCY.description: When the sun hunter is destroyed, they explode in a blast of flame that deals @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:27|basic:true] save). Creatures that critically fail their saves are marked with Walkena's religious symbol on a visible area of their body, which remains for 1 day. This mark allows Walkena to treat the creature as if he knew the creature's identity but not having met them for the purposes of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r784cIz17eWujtQj]{Scrying}, lowering the spell's DC by 2. The sun hunter's gear and treasure are unaffected by the explosion and left in a pile where they die.
orBkSImTP2bkbSCY.name: Burning Sacrifice

tyt6p82kfjac93i8.description:
Trigger The sun hunter is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker they can see

Effect The sun hunter gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
tyt6p82kfjac93i8.name: Nimble Dodge

CNhangp41gg69n5j.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.
CNhangp41gg69n5j.name: Religious Symbol of Walkena

MjZ6r13rFpvXUknN.description:
This staff resembles a blackened and burned length of ashen wood. It smells faintly of soot and glows as if lit by embers. You can use an Interact action to touch the tip of this staff to a torch, tinder, or a flammable substance to ignite a flame.

Activate Cast a Spell

Effect You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

Craft Requirements Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

  • Cantrip @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.O9w7r4BKgPogYDDe]{Produce Flame}
  • 1st @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.y6rAdMK6EFlV6U0t]{Breathe Fire}
  • 2nd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.y6rAdMK6EFlV6U0t]{Breathe Fire} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2ZdHjnpEQJuqOYSG]{Floating Flame}
  • 3rd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2ZdHjnpEQJuqOYSG]{Floating Flame} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball}
  • 4th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YrzBLPLd3r9m6t1p]{Fire Shield}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IarZrgCeaiUqOuRu]{Wall of Fire}
  • 5th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IarZrgCeaiUqOuRu]{Wall of Fire}

v1sqye17wnptdsdk.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The sun mage produces a specialized flame that burns away maladies and restores a creature. If the sun mage's next action is to Cast a Spell with the fire trait that deals damage and isn't a cantrip, the spell doesn't deal any damage. It instead restores a number of Hit Points equal to four times the spell's rank to all targets or creatures. This restoration affects all creatures regardless of whether they are healed by vitality or void energy.
v1sqye17wnptdsdk.name: Revitalizing Flame

x19uypog4dal3phf.description: When the sun mage is destroyed, they explode in a blast of flame that deals @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:27|basic:true] save). Creatures that critically fail their saves are marked with Walkena's religious symbol on a visible area of their body, which remains for 1 day. This mark allows Walkena to treat the creature as if he knew the creature's identity but not having met them for the purposes of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r784cIz17eWujtQj]{Scrying}, lowering the spell's DC by 2. The sun mage's gear and treasure are unaffected by the explosion and left in a pile where they die.
x19uypog4dal3phf.name: Burning Sacrifice

A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

LNLcZM8Zey6AJOUM.description:
This +2 greater striking @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XszNvxnymWYRaoTp]{Flaming} spear has a blade shaped like stylized flames. When wielded, the blade projects illumination resembling shimmering firelight, emitting dim light in a 10-foot radius.

Activate 2 command, Interact

Effect You cast the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.O9w7r4BKgPogYDDe]{Produce Flame} cantrip from the spear as a 7th-rank arcane spell, using your melee attack modifier with flame spike as your spell attack modifier.
LNLcZM8Zey6AJOUM.name: Flame Spike

ktu4dcjq7saxgc3c.description: The sun warrior attempts to drive their spear through a foe to pin them in place. The sun warrior makes a spear Strike. On a hit, the target's clothes, armor, or other piece of equipment becomes pinned to the ground. The sun warrior Releases the spear, and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until they can remove the spear (Escape DC 27). If the Strike was a critical hit, the DC increases by 2.
ktu4dcjq7saxgc3c.name: Pinning Thrust

oq77hmot8z0rlcmb.description: When the sun warrior is destroyed, they explode in a blast of flame that deals @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:27|basic:true] save). Creatures that critically fail their saves are marked with Walkena's religious symbol on a visible area of their body, which remains for 1 day. This mark allows Walkena to treat the creature as if he knew the creature's identity but not having met them for the purposes of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r784cIz17eWujtQj]{Scrying}, lowering the spell's DC by 2. The sun warrior's gear and treasure are unaffected by the explosion and left in a pile where they die.
oq77hmot8z0rlcmb.name: Burning Sacrifice

un8difxpqnv34qtw.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The sun warrior swings their weapon with a sweeping spin. They attempt separate Athletics checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} any number of creatures within their reach. Each attempt counts toward the sun warrior's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after they make all the attacks.
un8difxpqnv34qtw.name: Knocking Sweep

5zzsahgrf02p7stk.description: The red commander ant designates a single creature within 60 feet that it can see as its queen's enemy. All ants within 120 feet of the red commander ant deal an additional @Damage[1d8[bleed]] damage when they hit the target with mandibles Strikes. These effects last for 1 minute, or until the red commander ant uses The Queen's Enemy on a different creature.
5zzsahgrf02p7stk.name: The Queen's Enemy

lh29vfmsxvej89dh.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} (1 round)
