Spider Summoning Rune.description: An @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} rune on the floor summons a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.T5CUuPsMPb17d6Qy]{Goliath Spider} when disturbed by someone who isn't wearing Norgorber's religious symbol.
Spider Summoning Rune.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:34|name:Erase the Rune|traits:uncommon,magical,trap,complex] (master) to erase the rune or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (6th rank; counteract DC 36) to dispel the rune.
Spider Summoning Rune.name: Spider Summoning Rune

Ssumzili.description: Ssumzilis are lanky, murderous fey who delight in the thrill of the hunt. They are particularly skilled/adept at stalking their prey in the rain and most commonly reside in rainforests and coastal regions, where frequent rain provides ample opportunity to hunt. Camouflaged by their cloud-gray skin, ssumzilis often compete in tests of stealth when hunting in groups, taking particular delight in approaching their quarry as closely as possible without being observed.

4o6reppukpfo6pb7.description:
The ssumzili makes a melee Strike. If the Strike damages the target, the target must also attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature becomes soaked, causing them to treat the environmental temperature as one step colder (mild to severe, severe to extreme, and so on) until they dry off.

Failure As success, and the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure but the fatigue lasts until the target gets a full night's rest.
4o6reppukpfo6pb7.name: Soaking Strike

78szm6iaxw3d58yq.description: 10 feet. When it rains, the ground near a ssumzili becomes slick. When raining, all terrain within 10 feet of a ssumzili is slippery, with the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Wu0xFpewMKRK3HG8]{Grease} (DC 29). Ssumzilis are immune to this effect.
78szm6iaxw3d58yq.name: Standing Water

jsf0vyocbwrayp3d.description: A ssumzili can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} in rainfall, even if it doesn't have cover.
jsf0vyocbwrayp3d.name: Precipitation Camouflage

oSlZ5h47sAGSUiEK.description: A ssumzili deals an additional 2d6 precision damage precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

uovsta00w6nycpdc.description: A ssumzili ignores sensory difficulties caused by rain.
uovsta00w6nycpdc.name: Deluge Vision

vk9ugiypfhn6ztji.description: A ssumzili ignores difficult terrain caused by rain, such as puddles or wet rocks.
vk9ugiypfhn6ztji.name: Puddle Stride

Ssumzili.name: Ssumzili

Stinger Ward Trap.description: A ghostly stinger appears in the air and jabs at anyone moving through the opening.
Stinger Ward Trap.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:36|name:Prevent Ghostly Stinger from Forming|traits:uncommon,magical,trap] (master) to prevent the ghostly stinger from forming or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (6th level; counteract DC 34).
Stinger Ward Trap.name: Stinger Ward Trap

Au202xSbKeSVX8wX.description:
Requirements A foe within Stone Ghost's reach is standing on stone or soil

Effect Stone Ghost briefly extends his intangibility to a foe and drags or pounds them into the earth. He makes an @Check[type:athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the target's Fortitude DC. On a success, the foe is planted waist-deep in the ground and is immobilized and off-guard until it Escapes (DC 22). On a critical success, the foe is completely buried and must hold its breath until it is free or else start suffocating. A successful Escape returns the foe to its original square on the surface, or the closest unoccupied square.
Au202xSbKeSVX8wX.name: Entombing Grasp

MD93ARBxexU8Wbwm.description: Stone Ghost can pass through objects made of stone or soil, including walls. When inside an object, Stone Ghost can't perceive, attack, or interact with anything outside the object, and if he starts his turn inside an object, he is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.
MD93ARBxexU8Wbwm.name: Stone Spirit

X3Vr9xon3Ojv8JgZ.description: You create up to four floating lights, no two of which are more than 10 feet apart. Each sheds light like a torch. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.
X3Vr9xon3Ojv8JgZ.name: Dancing Lights

08c6nxgvp7vwy8xp.description: The brigade calls upon Walkena to burn and blind their foes. The sun warriors present their religious symbols and create a white-hot flash of light in a @Template[type:cone|distance:45]. Creatures in the cone take @Damage[10d8[fire]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:29|basic:true] save). Creatures that fail their save become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round. Creatures that critically fail become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round instead. When the troop is reduced to 8 or fewer squares, this area decreases to a @Template[type:cone|distance:20].
08c6nxgvp7vwy8xp.name: Walkena's Radiance

27wk99n7dr6shzeq.description: Whenever the troop Strides, they first Form Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then move up to their Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square of the troop enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to the whole troop.
27wk99n7dr6shzeq.name: Troop Movement

esi9bcvmzm1ej8ef.description: When the sun warrior brigade Casts a Spell, its constituent members combine their efforts into casting a more powerful version of the spell than any one member could achieve alone. When Casting a Spell that has an area of a burst, cone, or line and doesn't have a duration, increase the area of that spell. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius is not affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet long or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.
esi9bcvmzm1ej8ef.name: Troop Spellcasting

oxt3avp66riyk2nh.description:
1 to 3 actions

Frequency once per round

Effect The members of the brigade wildly swing their weapons-primarily spears-in a frenzied attack at each enemy adjacent to the troop (@Check[type:reflex|dc:29|basic:true] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d12+1)[piercing]] damage

2 @Damage[(2d12+11)[piercing]] damage

3 @Damage[(3d12+11)[piercing]] damage
oxt3avp66riyk2nh.name: Frenetic Assault

6x0bkjezr6333mqm.description: 60 feet. The sunburst corpse sheds bright light. Any creature that starts its turn in the emanation must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:31] save. If it fails, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 minute, and if it critically fails, it's blinded permanently. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to this effect for 24 hours.
6x0bkjezr6333mqm.name: Blinding Aura

GwIFweEMjNfnhHBa.description:
@Damage[(2d6+6)[bludgeoning],2d8[fire]]{2d6+6 bludgeoning plus 2d8 fire} and Residual Light, @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34|basic:true]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

pwl8fa1ev5dj8d7q.description: The sunburst corpse intensifies its light and unleashes a burning blast of energy. It deals @Damage[12d8[fire]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:34|basic:true] save). A creature that fails its save becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} until the end of its next turn. The sunburst corpse can't use Nova Burst again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Nova Burst]]{1d4 rounds}, and its blinding aura becomes inactive during this time.
pwl8fa1ev5dj8d7q.name: Nova Burst

s7iuu46czym34fcj.description: The sunburst corpse is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} in areas of natural bright light, such as due to sunlight or torches, even to creatures that can see clearly in bright light. Magical bright light and light from the sunburst corpse's blinding aura don't conceal the sunburst corpse.
s7iuu46czym34fcj.name: Light Camouflage

vrzmuimx9amhj6g0.description: When a sunburst corpse Strikes or Grapples a creature, some of the corpse's light clings to the creature for a moment. The creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} until the end of its next turn. On a critical failure, the creature is dazzled for 1 minute. A dazzled creature can use an Interact action to wick off the light and remove the dazzled condition.
vrzmuimx9amhj6g0.name: Residual Light

zu8bqkgi8bpopt54.description: A sunburst corpse is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} while in areas of magical darkness. If the level of the magical darkness effect is at least half of the sunburst corpse's level (a 7th-rank effect against most sunburst corpses), the sunburst corpse is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} while in the area.
zu8bqkgi8bpopt54.name: Darkness Vulnerability

Ta'apundo.description: The First World still holds the first rough draft of many creatures in the Material Plane, but it's hard to tell what sort of creature the ta'apundo was ever intended to be. Its bark poses significant danger to metallic objects, as it converts any metal touching it into wood as fibrous and as flexible as its own body. Capricious and skittish, ta'apundos make friends easily but consider anyone who wields or wears metal to be a hated enemy.

0jys5c0wzpevubc7.description: Vegetation doesn't impair a ta'apundo's vision and doesn't provide a creature cover or concealment from a ta'apundo.
0jys5c0wzpevubc7.name: Greensight

0u8ajvtxgwneihsd.description: A ta'apundo has resistance 20 against wooden objects and unarmed attacks from creatures made mostly of wood (such as arboreals).
0u8ajvtxgwneihsd.name: Wood Resistance

p1sbqkbkmmcbpn36.description: The ta'apundo makes four branch Strikes against different targets, increasing its reach to 20 feet for these Strikes. These attacks count toward its multiple attack penalty, but this penalty doesn't increase until after all four attacks.
p1sbqkbkmmcbpn36.name: Branch Whip

rcm4aifrs5kq8gp5.description:
Trigger a non-cold iron metal object damages the ta'apundo

Effect The ta'apundo emits a jolt of magic into the object, transforming it into wood with an unlimited duration. A thrown weapon, ammunition, or other unattended item automatically transforms; the wielder of an attended object can resist this effect with a successful @Check[type:fortitude|dc:41] save. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} can end the effect. While a weapon is wood, the ta'apundo's resistance applies. Once transformed, a formerly metal item's Hardness and HP change to those of wood. This typically inflicts a -2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls made with metal weapons and a -2 circumstance penalty to AC for those wearing metal armor; the GM might determine a different penalty for a specific weapon or armor.
rcm4aifrs5kq8gp5.name: Lignification

syfoe4g6n1h382lz.description: The ta'apundo ignores difficult and greater difficult terrain from foliage.
syfoe4g6n1h382lz.name: Woodland Stride

Ta'apundo.name: Ta'apundo

WOlakZKHYFrkqppw.description: A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain [[/r 1d8[healing]]] Hit Points.

WrosmjQTJ9TqWdBj.description:
Trigger An ally Takulu can see and who can hear Takulu makes a skill check or an attack roll

Effect Takulu grants the ally a +2 circumstance bonus to the triggering check.
WrosmjQTJ9TqWdBj.name: Quick Lesson

Taon.description:
The weight of murder wears heavy on the soul. With souls marked by a lifetime of dealing death, these killers, whether mass murderers, bloodthirsty soldiers, or sadistic executioners, sometimes do not let judgment and lawful execution stanch their slaying sprees. When such individuals are brought to justice, they may rise after death as mohrgs to continue their ruinous work.

Drawn to others of their kind, mohrgs prefer to hunt in small groups, occasionally in partnership with weaker free-willed undead such as shadows and wights. They seek out weak prey and revel in causing drawn-out suffering. Some mohrgs haunt locations they favored in life, reenacting old crimes on new victims. They may even skulk about in public, wearing rags, cloaks, or freshly harvested skins to hide their nature. The most dangerous mohrgs are those who grow powerful enough to no longer fear being struck down again and openly assault settlements in an attempt to turn living towns into mass graves.

Since those slain by a mohrg rise soon thereafter as mohrg spawn, the murders of a mohrg rarely go unnoticed for long, even when they take extra care to prey only on a society's dregs. Since mohrg spawn remain under a mohrg's control, a canny mohrg might order its spawn to remain in hiding to keep its presence secret until a point where it feels confident unleashing its undead army upon a doomed settlement.

Mohrgs retain a twisted sentimentality for the crimes of their mortal life, seeking out trinkets that remind them of favorite murders. When not out hunting, mohrgs arrange their mementos into disturbing shrines. Often, these trinkets are valuable objects, and might even provide important clues to ongoing mysteries.

AC6bEX8vPlS93zdE.description:
The blade of this +2 greater striking adamantine longsword seems to absorb light from the air around it, giving the impression the wielder is standing in the shadow of a much larger creature.

While Spellcutter is a potent weapon for battling undead and constructs, an ancient restriction on the blade prevents it from harming living creatures; attacks against living beings deal no damage. This restriction doesn't apply to dhampirs or creatures with the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.TTCw5NusiSSkJU1x]{Void Healing} ability who are otherwise living; the magic of the blade can't distinguish between such beings and undead.

Activate R envision

Trigger You're targeted by a spell while wielding Spellcutter

Effect Spellcutter attempts to absorb the magic of the triggering spell, giving you a +4 status bonus to your AC and saves against the effect.

Activate 1 Interact

Effect Touching Spellcutter to any light source of 12th level or lower (including 6th-rank spells with the light trait) instantly extinguishes the effect. If the source of the light is a large flame, such as a forest fire or bonfire, it only extinguishes the light source in a 5-foot radius burst from the point of contact.

JxUugYE35wuDrL4P.description:
A living creature slain by a mohrg that had a lower level than the mohrg rises as a mohrg spawn after [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, on its turn. This mohrg spawn is under the command of the mohrg that created it.

If the creator of the mohrg spawn is destroyed, the mohrg spawn is destroyed as well, immediately collapsing into a pile of decayed flesh and bones.
JxUugYE35wuDrL4P.name: Mohrg Spawn

lpA0GL54p2HVAWCw.description: Taon gains an extra reaction each round that can be used only to make an Attack of Opportunity.
lpA0GL54p2HVAWCw.name: Cruel Reactions

zJ48k7LkzzGzYZXF.description: A living creature hit by a mohrg's tongue Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:30] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. The creature can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each attempt.
zJ48k7LkzzGzYZXF.name: Paralysis

Taon.name: Taon

291km5v3jjb679dn.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect Tatterthread produces a scrap of shadow linked to the fate of a creature within 100 feet of her, then snips it with her caustic shears. The target takes @Damage[100[acid]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:42|basic:true]). If the target is reduced to 0 Hit Points from this damage, it melts into a puddle of fetid acid and dies immediately. If the target failed the saving throw, it loses any acid resistance it has for 1 minute (1 day on a critical failure). A creature slain by Shadow Snip can't be restored to life except by miracle, wish, or similarly powerful magic, or by divine intervention. Regardless of the outcome of its save, a creature targeted by Shadow Snip becomes temporarily immune for 24 hours. The norn can't use Shadow Snip again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Shadow Snip]]{1d4 rounds}.
291km5v3jjb679dn.name: Shadow Snip

2uz3cp2ye4ku791n.description:
Trigger A creature within 120 feet attempts a saving throw

Effect The creature rolls the save twice, and then Tatterthread decides which result applies. If she chooses the lower roll, this is a misfortune effect; if she chooses the higher roll, it's a fortune effect; if they're the same, she decides which trait to apply.
2uz3cp2ye4ku791n.name: Shift Fate

518te1yujw43d3x5.description: When Tatterthread rolls initiative, enemies she can see within 120 feet that are also rolling initiative automatically roll a 1.
518te1yujw43d3x5.name: Deny Fate

5wzebnl4wgdnomnz.description: When a creature is subject to a fortune effect from a norn and a misfortune effect from any source other than a norn (or vice versa), the norn's effect automatically counteracts the other effect and then takes place normally, rather than the two effects canceling each other out. If both the fortune and misfortune effect are from a norn, then the two cancel each other out as normal. At the GM's discretion, powerful entities related to fate or luck, like Desna, Magdh, or Pharasma, count as a norn for the purpose of this ability.
5wzebnl4wgdnomnz.name: Fated

hrw36t1rizoo7ehh.description: When Tatterthread deals acid damage with a Strike, she regains [[/r 10[healing]]]{10 Hit Points}. The target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:39] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2} on a critical failure).
hrw36t1rizoo7ehh.name: Shadow Corrosion

Tatterthread.name: Tatterthread
Tatterthread.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

cakus4is2nfhmd30.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The Terwa chosen looks to the sky for a star to guide their attack. The Terwa chosen gains the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Gb7SeieEvd0pL2Eh]{Sure Strike}.
cakus4is2nfhmd30.name: Champion's Star

j8a2y33slhmfgn10.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The Terwa chosen calls upon the stars to empower their attack. They attempt a Strike. If the Strike hits, the Terwa chosen deals an additional 2d6 precision damage.
j8a2y33slhmfgn10.name: Celestial Might

r2ezwnk7aqzsorz5.description:
Frequency once per day Trigger The Terwa chosen rolls a success or a critical failure on a check

Effect The Terwa chosen improves the triggering roll by one degree of success, only from a success to a critical success or from a critical failure to a failure.
r2ezwnk7aqzsorz5.name: Born Lucky

udqc7wyyetj7r9g4.description: A Terwa chosen can hold their breath for 10 minutes.
udqc7wyyetj7r9g4.name: Deep Breath

41wnvdbo0yfh9ho4.description: A terwa prodigy can hold their breath for 10 minutes.
41wnvdbo0yfh9ho4.name: Deep Breath

JlZEwxChUJYtrc6E.description:
This staff resembles a blackened and burned length of ashen wood. It smells faintly of soot and glows as if lit by embers. You can use an Interact action to touch the tip of this staff to a torch, tinder, or a flammable substance to ignite a flame.

Activate Cast a Spell

Effect You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

Craft Requirements Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

  • Cantrip @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.O9w7r4BKgPogYDDe]{Produce Flame}
  • 1st @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.y6rAdMK6EFlV6U0t]{Breathe Fire}

jkhwxgqejbao0fio.description: The star reader finds the star that would guide their own attack or that of an ally. The star reader grants themselves or an ally within 30 feet the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Gb7SeieEvd0pL2Eh]{Sure Strike}. If the star reader chooses an ally, the duration lasts until the end of that creature's turn. The target is then temporarily immune to Guiding Star for 1 day.
jkhwxgqejbao0fio.name: Guiding Star

kxzi9fot877vdfzq.description: A Terwa star reader can hold their breath for 10 minutes.
kxzi9fot877vdfzq.name: Deep Breath

uyqangw1ssetun1h.description:
Frequency once per day Trigger An attack or effect would reduce an ally within 30 feet to 0 Hit Points or would cause the ally to gain the dying condition

Effect The star reader interprets the meaning of astrological omens in an instant, determining a new fate for the ally. The triggering ally remains at 1 Hit Point, does not increase their dying or wounded condition, and gains 10 temporary Hit Points for 1 round.
uyqangw1ssetun1h.name: Move the Stars

Thasteron Khefak.description:
Thasteron khefaks are alchemically enhanced versions of standard khefaks, capable of converting the minerals they eat into thasteron. While thasteron remains highly valuable as fuel and for specialized weapons, finding an experienced thasteron khefak breeder is hard because the creatures become radioactive over time.

This unusual arthropod resembles an amalgam of a centipede and a crab. Hard-shelled and perfectly suited to life on Akiton, khefaks are so incredibly useful that a visitor to the planet might assume they were custom engineered for their environs. Such visitors would, in fact, be correct. While khefaks can be found naturally on Akiton, a new species has recently gained a foothold on the planet: alchemically engineered khefaks who excrete a refined substance that can be used as fuel to power advanced engines and devices.

1ljbfkqhw711z50x.description: 10 feet. Thasteron khefaks convert radioactive minerals they eat into thasteron, a combustive fuel. The more radioactive elements of the material concentrates in their chitin and taints the air around them. A creature who begins their turn within this aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] saving throw or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).
1ljbfkqhw711z50x.name: Radiation Aura

2pxy463mt7jqqlxm.description: A khefak can gain nourishment by eating objects with hardness 10 or lower. When attacking an object with its mandibles, it ignores the first 10 points of that object's Hardness.
2pxy463mt7jqqlxm.name: Consume Objects

Thasteron Khefak.name: Thasteron Khefak

0nn6RpFqlRIftZUN.description:
You need thieves' tools to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick Locks} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable Devices} (of some types) using the Thievery skill. Infiltrator thieves' tools add a +1 item bonus to checks to Pick Locks and Disable Devices.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.BznmPaRjI4Orb0IH]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action. If you wear your thieves' tools, you can draw and replace them as part of the action that uses them.
0nn6RpFqlRIftZUN.name: Thieves' Tools (Infiltrator)

8f596g9ds4362vda.description: Thiarvo ignores difficult terrain from trees, foliage, rubble, and undergrowth.
8f596g9ds4362vda.name: Slippery Halfling

T5Ozwcwr66cM7vGF.description:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 2d8 fire damage, 2 persistent fire damage, and 2 fire splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

TIqD08V1AHKYTTcS.description:
This hard but flexible longsword-length piece of wood looks more like a pole than a weapon, but can be deadly in the right hands. While generally not used for combat outside of Song'o culture, some halflings have become so proficient as to make it just as effective as a blade in a fight. Many halflings will even sing to maintain a certain tempo and rhythm during combat. It deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage. A fighting stick is a martial one-handed melee weapon in the club weapon group.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6wVWwpL9pYr3yQtt]{Rod of Wonder}
TIqD08V1AHKYTTcS.name: +1 Striking Rod of Wonder

XJxOK8est48YQTHH.description: A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain [[/r (3d8+10)[healing]]]{3d8+10 Hit Points}.

fb9tq8ocb98sl1mc.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Thiarvo fails a skill check or a saving throw

Effect Thiarvo rerolls the triggering check and must use the new result.
fb9tq8ocb98sl1mc.name: Halfling Luck

hwhksgxt4f6ui2os.description: Thiarvo can make lethal attacks using weapons with the nonlethal trait without taking the usual -2 penalty. His attacks with weapons with the nonlethal trait deal an additional 2d8 precision damage, whether he's making nonlethal attacks or lethal attacks with them. This damage is included in his melee entry.
hwhksgxt4f6ui2os.name: Lethal Fighter

tjsum3u1y9q79gai.description: Thiarvo's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6wVWwpL9pYr3yQtt]{Rod of Wonder} is supple wood and can be used as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.17MQKaMIHQAJNtuu]{Fighting Stick}. It can be enchanted with fundamental runes but not property runes, and it's currently enchanted with the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.DKWuJb2rSgiotOG7]{Weapon Potency (+1)} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.DxCuJKynlnMQZHgp]{Striking} runes.
tjsum3u1y9q79gai.name: Fighting Rod

0jjczv5v33ef456x.description:
Requirements The thorn guardian is Bonded with or adjacent to its ward

Effect The thorn guardian interposes itself between the ward and its foes, granting its ward a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of the thorn guardian's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.7PjBr9LsVB0Jjzyu]{Effect: Interpose}
0jjczv5v33ef456x.name: Interpose

q5q18a8pjacvh8kh.description:
Requirements The thorn guardian is adjacent to its ward

Effect The thorn guardian enters its ward's space and encases the creature. This doesn't interfere with its ward's senses or actions. The thorn guardian occupies the same space as its ward and moves with its ward.

While worn, the thorn guardian establishes a constant @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.d7Lwx6KAs47MtF0q]{Share Life} effect with its ward. Attacks that target the thorn guardian target the ward instead but use the higher AC or saving throw values between the thorn guardian and the ward. Area effects apply to both the thorn guardian and the ward, as normal for an area effect.
q5q18a8pjacvh8kh.name: Bond with Ward

sfko8ztlbbitvfik.description:
Trigger A creature within the thorn guardian's reach attacks the guardian's ward

Effect The thorn guardian makes a briar Strike against the triggering creature. If it hits, it deals an additional @Damage[2d6[bleed]].
sfko8ztlbbitvfik.name: Retaliate

xwlrc0y7m4gbb0aj.description: A thorn guardian gains an additional reaction each turn but can use this extra reaction only to Retaliate.
xwlrc0y7m4gbb0aj.name: Extra Reaction

y9n6o01btwmvgxlj.description:
Requirements The thorn guardian is Bonded with its Ward

Effect The thorn guardian removes itself from the ward and enters an adjacent space.
y9n6o01btwmvgxlj.name: Fly Free

FZCAaPvlKFaCUike.description:
If the heroes destroy Dwandek (even if only temporarily, before destroying his soul cage as well), the cathedral's hold over Tollvych's soul loosens; the next time the heroes enter this room (or 24 hours later), his ghost rises one last time from his remains with a sigh, and then moves into the afterlife.

When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.
FZCAaPvlKFaCUike.name: Rejuvenation

f9zxVP3AbmhpFkVz.description:
Tollvych laments his fate, forcing each living creature within 30 feet to attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:36] save.

On a failure, a creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to this Tollvych's frightful moan for 1 minute.
f9zxVP3AbmhpFkVz.name: Frightful Moan

pi1n8njsrdm3lo4n.description:
Tollvych cries out in pain as his body twists and grinds into horrific, distorted shapes. All creatures within a 30-foot emanation take @Damage[16d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:36|basic:true] save) as the sound of the Bone-Shattering Cry shakes and shatters their own bones.

Tollvych can't use Bone-Shattering Cry for [[/br 1d4 #Bone-Shattering Cry Recharge]]{1d4 rounds}.
pi1n8njsrdm3lo4n.name: Bone-Shattering Cry

5WtrZgxRqrE1ciIF.description: If Umbo is reduced to 0 HP by a critical hit, he pops, forcing him to immediately Emit Spores, even if he has already used the ability that day.
5WtrZgxRqrE1ciIF.name: Spore Pop

DGvtV8KKlmaTQwzr.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Umbo expels spores in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] centered on a corner of his own space. This cloud lasts until the start of the myceloid's next turn. Each creature that is in the cloud or enters it is exposed to purple pox.
DGvtV8KKlmaTQwzr.name: Emit Spores

XoaDpd9D4HVu0eyz.description:
Myceloids are immune

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18|name:Resist Infection]

Onset 1 minute

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3}, and the creature is compelled to seek out the nearest myceloid colony-this compulsion is a mental emotion effect (1 day)

Stage 3 The creature dies. Over 24 hours, its corpse becomes bloated and bursts, releasing a new, fully grown myceloid.
XoaDpd9D4HVu0eyz.name: Purple Pox

bN0GurNk8sfBe4aX.name: Telepathy 100 feet (Myceloids and Those Afflicted by Purple Pox Only)

jfKBMXemc9SBW9bb.description:
Umbo targets one creature affected by purple pox within 30 feet. That creature must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:18|name:Resist Domination|traits:emotion,incapacitation] save. It is then temporarily immune to spore domination for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success Until the end of its next turn, the target is helpful to myceloids and can't take hostile actions against them. If attacked by Umbo, the target is freed from this effect at the end of Umbo's turn.

Failure As success, but for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As success, but until the purple pox is cured.
jfKBMXemc9SBW9bb.name: Spore Domination

Nv8YtW2xPTnP0KrJ.description: Anchor Root's shadow has become corrupted via the power of the Vesicant Egg. Her shredded shadow grants her some control over acid and shadows. She gains a +4 status bonus to resist acid and shadow effects.
Nv8YtW2xPTnP0KrJ.name: Vesicated Shadow

O7Nkcu4MCIufyEcJ.description:
Anchor Root can create immense blisters on a creature's shadow, which immediately burst, dealing @Damage[20d6[acid]] damage. She targets a creature within 60 feet that is casting a shadow, which must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:37] save. Anchor Root can't use Rupture Shadow again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Rupture Shadow]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune for 1 day.

Success The target takes half damage. The bursting shadow deals @Damage[(5[splash])[acid]]{5 acid splash} damage to all creatures within 5 feet of the target.

Failure The target takes full damage, and the bursting shadow deals @Damage[(10[splash])[acid]]{10 acid splash} damage.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage, the bursting shadow deals @Damage[(20[splash])[acid]]{20 acid splash} damage, and the target also takes @Damage[4d6[persistent,acid]] damage.
O7Nkcu4MCIufyEcJ.name: Rupture Shadow

XzWllQOTD8ZvW9Oi.description: When Anchor Root has fewer than 150 Hit Points, her shadow pulls at her essence to show the Vesicant Egg's displeasure. She looks pained and confused, and she becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until healed to 150 Hit Points or more. These conditions increase to 2 when below 100 Hit Points. When below 50 Hit Points, she falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}.
XzWllQOTD8ZvW9Oi.name: Shadow's Displeasure

8cIoZgJYjTSQNeqn.description:
Haibam can create immense blisters on a creature's shadow, which immediately burst, dealing @Damage[20d6[acid]] damage. He targets a creature within 60 feet that is casting a shadow, which must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:37] save. Haibam can't use Rupture Shadow again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Rupture Shadow]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune for 1 day.

Success The target takes half damage. The bursting shadow deals @Damage[(5[splash])[acid]]{5 acid splash} damage to all creatures within 5 feet of the target.

Failure The target takes full damage, and the bursting shadow deals @Damage[(10[splash])[acid]]{10 acid splash} damage.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage, the bursting shadow deals @Damage[(20[splash])[acid]]{20 acid splash} damage, and the target also takes @Damage[4d6[persistent,acid]] damage.
8cIoZgJYjTSQNeqn.name: Rupture Shadow

g9ab3molowrdwii3.description: Haibram imbues a weapon he's holding with the power of the wind until the start of his next turn. The wind's power allows Haibram to swing and hurl the weapon with great force, causing the weapon to deal an additional 2d10 damage. If the weapon does not have the thrown trait, it also gains the thrown 10 feet trait during this attack.
g9ab3molowrdwii3.name: Wind Touch

hEpxe1FfIjVaqxj4.description: When Haibam has fewer than 150 Hit Points, his shadow pulls at his essence to show the Vesicant Egg's displeasure. He looks pained and confused, and he becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until healed to 150 Hit Points or more. These conditions increase to 2 when below 100 Hit Points. When below 50 Hit Points, he falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}.
hEpxe1FfIjVaqxj4.name: Shadow's Displeasure

skiRGL9UQGWGEdSZ.description: Haibam's shadow has become corrupted via the power of the Vesicant Egg. His shredded shadow grants him some control over acid and shadows. He gains a +4 status bonus to resist acid and shadow effects.
skiRGL9UQGWGEdSZ.name: Vesicated Shadow

smorxcoe1pndxktg.description: Haibram draws air around him to aid his movement. He Strides up to his Speed, gaining the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b5sGjGlBf58f8jn0]{Air Walk} and ignoring difficult terrain while moving. He can increase the number of actions to 3 to Stride up to three times his Speed instead. Haibram begins to fall immediately after using Wind Step but treats the fall as 60 feet shorter thanks to the supporting winds.
smorxcoe1pndxktg.name: Wind Step

IHURJGCRE1ctHuEN.description: When Koride has fewer than 150 Hit Points, her shadow pulls at her essence to show the Vesicant Egg's displeasure. She looks pained and confused, and she becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until healed to 150 Hit Points or more. These conditions increase to 2 when below 100 Hit Points. When below 50 Hit Points, she falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}.
IHURJGCRE1ctHuEN.name: Shadow's Displeasure

IloKvYYEhGQ0wTFu.name: +3 Major Striking Staff of Nature's Vengeance (Major)

XxMTTN80Z84ZwYsz.description: Koride's shadow has become corrupted via the power of the Vesicant Egg. Her shredded shadow grants her some control over acid and shadows. She gains a +4 status bonus to resist acid and shadow effects.
XxMTTN80Z84ZwYsz.name: Vesicated Shadow

aKVxowf3fUlcmJuc.description:
Koride can create immense blisters on a creature's shadow, which immediately burst, dealing @Damage[20d6[acid]] damage. She targets a creature within 60 feet that is casting a shadow, which must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:37] save. Koride can't use Rupture Shadow again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Rupture Shadow]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune for 1 day.

Success The target takes half damage. The bursting shadow deals @Damage[(5[splash])[acid]]{5 acid splash} damage to all creatures within 5 feet of the target.

Failure The target takes full damage, and the bursting shadow deals @Damage[(10[splash])[acid]]{10 acid splash} damage.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage, the bursting shadow deals @Damage[(20[splash])[acid]]{20 acid splash} damage, and the target also takes @Damage[4d6[persistent,acid]] damage.
aKVxowf3fUlcmJuc.name: Rupture Shadow

F8cB9BOXSox2BLLk.description:
Mariama can create immense blisters on a creature's shadow, which immediately burst, dealing @Damage[20d6[acid]] damage. She targets a creature within 60 feet that is casting a shadow, which must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:37] save. Mariama can't use Rupture Shadow again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Rupture Shadow]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune for 1 day.

Success The target takes half damage. The bursting shadow deals @Damage[(5[splash])[acid]]{5 acid splash} damage to all creatures within 5 feet of the target.

Failure The target takes full damage, and the bursting shadow deals @Damage[(10[splash])[acid]]{10 acid splash} damage.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage, the bursting shadow deals @Damage[(20[splash])[acid]]{20 acid splash} damage, and the target also takes @Damage[4d6[persistent,acid]] damage.
F8cB9BOXSox2BLLk.name: Rupture Shadow

jpukmsf4fjjnmu64.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Mariama ties her fate with that of another creature within 30 feet. The creature must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:40] save. Regardless of the result of its save, the creature is temporarily immune for 1 day.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The two fates are bound. Whenever Mariama takes damage, the creature takes damage of the same type equal to half the damage Mariama took (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:37|basic:true]). Immunities, resistances, and weaknesses still apply as normal. The creature can attempt to sever the bond by spending an action, which has the concentrate trait, to attempt another @Check[type:will|dc:40] save. On a success, the bond is severed, and the effect ends. The bond also ends when Mariama falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or if she actively ends the effect herself as a free action.

Failure As success, but the creature takes damage equal to the full amount Mariama took. Severing the bond requires a 2-action activity, which has the concentrate trait.

Critical Failure As failure, but @Check[type:fortitude|dc:40|basic:true]. Severing the bond requires a 3-action activity, which has the concentrate trait.
jpukmsf4fjjnmu64.name: Bind Destinies

lPBT22qKUXpUirSM.description: When Mariama has fewer than 150 Hit Points, her shadow pulls at her essence to show the Vesicant Egg's displeasure. She looks pained and confused. When below 50 Hit Points, she falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}.
lPBT22qKUXpUirSM.name: Shadow's Displeasure

nx9wkk5vhucfm861.description: Perhaps because of Mariama's quirky nature, she has received all the effects of the astrological evaluator. When she gains any of the clumsy, drained, enfeebled, or stupefied conditions, she reduces the value by 1. This means her Shadow's Displeasure doesn't affect her until she has fewer than 50 Hit Points, when she falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}.
nx9wkk5vhucfm861.name: Weird Astrology

zhDB5m3eSThKE4Cc.description: Mariama's shadow has become corrupted via the power of the Vesicant Egg. Her shredded shadow grants her some control over acid and shadows. She gains a +4 status bonus to resist acid and shadow effects.
zhDB5m3eSThKE4Cc.name: Vesicated Shadow

1hjoyx9fc8r2v9tx.description:
Trigger Okoro targets a creature with an attack

Requirements The triggering creature was the target of Observe Weakness this turn

Effect Okoro draws upon his future luck to guarantee his attack. When he makes his attack roll, if he rolls lower than 10 on the die, he treats that attack roll as a 10 instead. This is in addition to rolling twice and taking the higher result from Observe Weakness. Afterward, Okoro's luck is temporarily spent, and he must roll twice and use the lower result of his next 3 checks; this is a misfortune effect. He can't use Push My Luck again until he's completed these 3 checks.
1hjoyx9fc8r2v9tx.name: Push My Luck

jvm0dsaowmfz1zgn.description: Okoro studies a creature within 30 feet to find an opening to attack. On his next attack roll against the creature this turn, he rolls twice and uses the higher result, and his attack gains the fortune trait. The target becomes temporarily immune for [[/r 1d4 #Observe Weakness Immunity]]{1d4 rounds}.
jvm0dsaowmfz1zgn.name: Observe Weakness

mds3qf6b45mnbotm.description:
Okoro can create immense blisters on a creature's shadow, which immediately burst, dealing @Damage[20d6[acid]] damage. He targets a creature within 60 feet that is casting a shadow, which must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:37] save. Okoro can't use Rupture Shadow again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Rupture Shadow]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune for 1 day.

Success The target takes half damage. The bursting shadow deals @Damage[(5[splash])[acid]]{5 acid splash} damage to all creatures within 5 feet of the target.

Failure The target takes full damage, and the bursting shadow deals @Damage[(10[splash])[acid]]{10 acid splash} damage.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage, the bursting shadow deals @Damage[(20[splash])[acid]]{20 acid splash} damage, and the target also takes @Damage[4d6[persistent,acid]] damage.
mds3qf6b45mnbotm.name: Rupture Shadow

rt2r6pmpylk7004h.description: Okoro's shadow has become corrupted via the power of the Vesicant Egg. His shredded shadow grants him some control over acid and shadows. He gains a +4 status bonus to resist acid and shadow effects.
rt2r6pmpylk7004h.name: Vesicated Shadow

xfqu4h4qvq9m5jap.description: When Okoro has fewer than 150 Hit Points, his shadow pulls at his essence to show the Vesicant Egg's displeasure. He looks pained and confused, and he becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until healed to 150 Hit Points or more. These conditions increase to 2 when below 100 Hit Points. When below 50 Hit Points, he falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}.
xfqu4h4qvq9m5jap.name: Shadow's Displeasure

Urbel.description:
The "towering" hunchbacked nuglubs are among the largest gremlins, though they're not quite three feet tall. Nuglubs have three glowing blue eyes and black, oily hair on their head and back that covers them like a cloak. Nuglubs enjoy killing with a glee that other gremlins reserve for sabotage. Indeed, they spend long hours preparing ambushes for unwary travelers or plotting the murders of sleeping villagers. Though less technically inclined than their kin, nuglubs do enjoy building traps. They delight in stealthily constructing traps in places their victims consider familiar, such as front doors and the floors around beds. If someone else gets blamed for the mayhem the nuglub creates, all the better.

In combat, nuglubs focus on targets wearing metal armor. Some attribute this to envy on the part of the nuglubs, who find it difficult to fit armor on their twisted bodies. Nuglubs are particularly talented at causing those nearby to stumble over them and fall prone. Once an enemy falls to the ground, all the nuglubs descend upon the target, biting and scratching until nothing remains.

Nuglubs rarely gather in groups larger than half a dozen, as quarrels often lead to violence and cannibalism. A lone nuglub who bullies a group of smaller gremlins is more likely to get their way, and thus less likely to attack their allies.

FhwufRLfw0dtrKFI.description:
Trigger A Medium creature within Urbel's reach leaves a square during its move action

Effect Urbel lashes out at the triggering creature's knees and tries to knock them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. He attempts an @Check[type:acrobatics|defense:reflex] check against the creature's Reflex DC. On a success, the target falls and lands Prone.
FhwufRLfw0dtrKFI.name: Kneecapper

HR2db2G0yyWKqC5x.description: Urbel's melee Strikes deal an additional 1d6 damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} targets.
HR2db2G0yyWKqC5x.name: Pound Down

XMY6Ffvkss4xKcjw.description: Any melee weapon Urbel uses gains the shove trait, and if he rolls a critical failure when attempting to Shove a creature with the weapon, he treats the result as a failure instead.
XMY6Ffvkss4xKcjw.name: Bully

Urbel.name: Urbel

Venom Pool.description: A shallow, foul-smelling puddle of toxic acid blocks a narrow hall (marked with a dotted line on the map), and poison bursts from it when disturbed.
Venom Pool.hazardDisable: @Check[type:crafting|dc:40|name:Neutralize the acid|traits:hazard,complex,environmental] (master) or @Check[type:survival|dc:42|name:Neutralize the acid|traits:hazard,complex,environmental] (legendary) to neutralize the acid while within reach of it. Three successes using either skill (or a combination of both) destroys the hazard.
Venom Pool.hazardReset: The hazard ends after 1 minute, contracting to its original size and keeping still until disturbed again.
Venom Pool.hazardRoutine: (2 actions) The hazard uses its first action to spread 10 feet down the hallway in both directions. Once out of the hall, each side spreads in a random direction each round, but they don't go through doors. The hazard uses its second action to move the center of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.MlpbeZ61Euhl0d60]{Toxic Cloud} up to 20 feet in any direction to which any part of the pool has line of effect (normally, to encompass the greatest number of characters). If the cloudkill isn't present, it instead uses its second action to produce a new cloudkill, as Poison Puff.
Venom Pool.name: Venom Pool

Wereant Disciple.description:
Insectile werecreatures, such as wereants, only come about in unusual circumstances, such as powerful curses from inhuman gods or transformative magic run amok. Wereants work together with a natural cohesion that's rare in other types of werecreatures. The wereants presented here are more powerful than most wereants, as they've been warped by the forces contained within the Vesicant Egg.

Some wereants have a religious zeal about training to protect their community and gladly give their lives for the hive.

35g2fh9fmfp3anxh.description:
Trigger A creature adjacent to the wereant critically misses the wereant with a melee Strike

Effect The wereant makes a mandibles Strike against the triggering creature.
35g2fh9fmfp3anxh.name: Gnawing Retort

dLLXCoWbblalgqjW.description:
This curse affects only humanoids

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34].

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into a wereant until dawn.

The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} until dawn.
dLLXCoWbblalgqjW.name: Curse of the Wereant

fnmutsbmx35qyk3d.description: Wereants operate with a shared hive intelligence. While within telepathic range of at least one other wereant, a wereant disciple gains a +2 circumstance bonus to initiative checks, Perception checks, and saving throws against mental effects. If one wereant is aware of a combatant, all members of the hive mind within telepathic range are aware of it.
fnmutsbmx35qyk3d.name: Hive Mind

grw0iihgx50xog7f.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The wereant disciple Flies and makes two Strikes against different targets at any point during that movement. These Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage if the disciple is above the target. If the wereant began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, they remain hidden until after this ability's Strikes. Both attacks count toward the disciple's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both Strikes.
grw0iihgx50xog7f.name: Flying Leap

ky5U9PGQOWpgWpjC.description:
The wereant changes into their humanoid, hybrid, or animal shape. Each shape has a specific, persistent appearance. A true wereant's natural form is their hybrid shape. In humanoid shape, they use their original humanoid size, lose their jaws and claw Strikes, and gain a melee fist Strike that deals bludgeoning damage equal to the slashing damage dealt by their mandibles. In animal shape, they take the form of a Medium giant ant, gain a climb Speed of 20 feet, gain Grab on their mandibles Strike, and lose their weapon Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

o5kYgNvC941Wm7mn.description:
When a full moon appears in the night sky, the wereant must enter hybrid form, can't Change Shape thereafter, becomes one size larger, increases its reach by 5 feet, and increases the damage of their mandibles Strike by 2.

When the moon sets or the sun rises, the werecreature returns to humanoid form and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for [[/br 2d4 #Fatigued duration]]{2d4 hours}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.dRe8n1nBWMIXd8jh]{Effect: Moon Frenzy}
o5kYgNvC941Wm7mn.name: Moon Frenzy

or2jprf57tejx70c.description: A creature damaged by the wereant disciple's carapace fist Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:35] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} on a critical failure). If the Strike is a critical hit, a creature that fails the save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.
or2jprf57tejx70c.name: Staggering Blow

Wereant Disciple.name: Wereant Disciple

Wereant Poisoner.description:
Insectile werecreatures, such as wereants, only come about in unusual circumstances, such as powerful curses from inhuman gods or transformative magic run amok. Wereants work together with a natural cohesion that's rare in other types of werecreatures. The wereants presented here are more powerful than most wereants, as they've been warped by the forces contained within the Vesicant Egg.

When overwhelming force is inadvisable, a wereant hive sends a poison-dripping assassin for murderous work. These poisoners love to terrify those dying in agony from their toxins.

3ggScBH5xJRksjF0.description:

In humanoid shape, they use their original humanoid size, lose their jaws and claw Strikes, and gain a melee fist Strike that deals bludgeoning damage equal to the slashing damage dealt by their mandibles. In animal shape, they take the form of a Medium giant ant, gain a climb Speed of 20 feet, gain Grab on their mandibles Strike, and lose their weapon Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

67nta5e94jefe99z.description: The wereant poisoner makes two kukri Strikes and a mandibles Strike in any order.
67nta5e94jefe99z.name: Poisonous Flurry

8nh48znq0ytxo14q.description: Weapons the wereant poisoner holds deal an additional @Damage[2d6[persistent,poison]] as poison seeps from the wereant's hands onto the weapon. Weapons cease to deal this persistent poison damage once the wereant lets them go. The kukri Strikes above include this persistent poison damage.
8nh48znq0ytxo14q.name: Envenomed Weapons

GyOwwVWZBfQazotf.description:
Trigger A creature adjacent to the wereant critically misses the wereant with a melee Strike

Effect The wereant makes a mandibles Strike against the triggering creature.
GyOwwVWZBfQazotf.name: Gnawing Retort

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.dRe8n1nBWMIXd8jh]{Effect: Moon Frenzy}
c1Uo44lQWgOcY82g.name: Moon Frenzy

o60iwfva1geln42u.description: If the wereant critically hits a creature with a melee Strike, that creature can't recover from persistent poison damage for 1 round.
o60iwfva1geln42u.name: Vitriolic Strikes

rie44HhT6OCUQnCT.description: Wereants operate with a shared hive intelligence. While within telepathic range of at least one other wereant, a wereant disciple gains a +2 circumstance bonus to initiative checks, Perception checks, and saving throws against mental effects. If one wereant is aware of a combatant, all members of the hive mind within telepathic range are aware of it.

The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} until dawn.
vCBcq5X4CA3AdJAt.name: Curse of the Wereant

Wereant Poisoner.name: Wereant Poisoner

5oy93mlwu2qa2pxi.description: The wereant sentinel plants its feet in defiance of those who would move it. It gains a +2 circumstance bonus to defenses against being Shoved or Tripped, and its melee Strikes deal an additional @Damage[2d8[mental]] damage. These effects end when it moves from its square using anything other than Hasty Reposition.
5oy93mlwu2qa2pxi.name: Sentinel's Focus

DulMJOAyRjcak9tj.description:
When a full moon appears in the night sky, the wereant must enter hybrid form, can't Change Shape thereafter, becomes one size larger, increases its reach by 5 feet, and increases the damage of their mandibles Strike by 2.

When the moon sets or the sun rises, the werecreature returns to humanoid form and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for [[/br 2d4 #Fatigued duration]]{2d4 hours}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.dRe8n1nBWMIXd8jh]{Effect: Moon Frenzy}

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34].

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into a wereant until dawn.

The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} until dawn.

Sp7WWm2pGV4gIgKP.description:
The wereant changes into their humanoid, hybrid, or animal shape. Each shape has a specific, persistent appearance. A true wereant's natural form is their hybrid shape. In humanoid shape, they use their original humanoid size, lose their jaws and claw Strikes, and gain a melee fist Strike that deals bludgeoning damage equal to the slashing damage dealt by their mandibles. In animal shape, they take the form of a Medium giant ant, gain a climb Speed of 20 feet, gain Grab on their mandibles Strike, and lose their weapon Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

an140aq05sh8og4u.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The wereant sentinel Steps, moving up to 15 feet.
an140aq05sh8og4u.name: Hasty Reposition

cOgYZNoEqQ0Ni017.description: Wereants operate with a shared hive intelligence. While within telepathic range of at least one other wereant, a wereant disciple gains a +2 circumstance bonus to initiative checks, Perception checks, and saving throws against mental effects. If one wereant is aware of a combatant, all members of the hive mind within telepathic range are aware of it.
cOgYZNoEqQ0Ni017.name: Hive Mind

op6gd7hr0h7gibpz.description:
Trigger An enemy damages the wereant sentinel's ally, and both are within 15 feet of the wereant sentinel

Effect The ally gains resistance 20 against the triggering damage. If the foe is within reach, the wereant sentinel makes a melee Strike against it.
op6gd7hr0h7gibpz.name: Retributive Strike

0q48g0slb1nvwana.description: Worknesh can recognize the skills of any combatants she faces. She can use Warfare Lore to Recall Knowledge about any creature, but only while in combat or observing the creature fight.
0q48g0slb1nvwana.name: Warmaster's Instinct

3dnz7i71dj85bgb7.description:
Frequency once per round Requirements Worknesh is within reach of an enemy designated by Walkena's Judgment

Effect Worknesh makes two melee Strikes against the enemy of Walkena. If both attacks hit, she combines their damage for the purpose of the creature's resistances and weaknesses.
3dnz7i71dj85bgb7.name: Walkena's Fury

5fcubhgvrgux06na.description:
Worknesh unleashes a war cry, granting herself and all allies within 60 feet a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls until the start of her next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.TjRZbd52qWPjTbNT]{Effect: Battle Cry}
5fcubhgvrgux06na.name: Battle Cry

lubmx5ry4yjy1q8b.description: Worknesh designates a single creature as an enemy of Walkena. She must be able to see or hear the creature, or she must be tracking the creature. Worknesh gains a +4 status bonus to damage against the designated creature, and she gains fast healing 5 while within 30 feet of the creature. In addition, she doesn't take the -2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls when attempting to deal nonlethal damage with an attack without the nonlethal trait and vice versa. Worknesh can have only one creature designated as an enemy of Walkena at a time. If she uses Walkena's Judgment against a creature when she already has a creature designated, the prior creature loses the designation and the new target gains the designation. This designation lasts for 24 hours.
lubmx5ry4yjy1q8b.name: Walkena's Judgment

piozygvswzbwhv9x.description:
Trigger Worknesh rolls initiative

Requirements Worknesh can perceive at least one foe within 60 feet

Effect Worknesh yells a mighty rallying cry. Worknesh attempts an Intimidation check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} a single foe within 60 feet. If successful, any of her allies within 30 feet can Stride up to double their speed as their first action on their first turn of the combat.
piozygvswzbwhv9x.name: Master's Cry

7xb9wi0nsdyrp0lb.description: A foe that takes damage from Yonsuu's melee Strike is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 3} if the Strike is a critical hit).
7xb9wi0nsdyrp0lb.name: Hampering Strike

PHMOfz77gyH98RBc.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.
PHMOfz77gyH98RBc.name: Religious Symbol of Norgorber (Wooden)

Xs4GwCjt0hjJoSXY.description:
Yonsuu deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to creatures that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} or within reach of at least one of their allies.

Yonsuu can make an attack with this additional damage as a nonlethal attack, if they choose.
Xs4GwCjt0hjJoSXY.name: Subduing Attack

nte7kutbe3lsm1cz.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Yonsuu fails or critically fails a Reflex saving throw

Effect Yonsuu rerolls the saving throw and takes the better result.
nte7kutbe3lsm1cz.name: Cat's Luck

8cQeqBe4ardii4WI.description: On the first round of combat, if Yorulu rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to them.
8cQeqBe4ardii4WI.name: Surprise Attack

BHLuJ4FL59ns2hP9.description: Yorulu Strides half their speed or less, that movement does not trigger reactions.
BHLuJ4FL59ns2hP9.name: Mobility

DgxyiFw40l3Jsbap.description: Yorulu deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Ip0IdKsc4MVs0bVA.description:
Trigger Yorulu is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker it can see.

Effect The burglar gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
Ip0IdKsc4MVs0bVA.name: Nimble Dodge

VJxUshIimp3PE5ts.name: +1 Circumstance to All Saves vs. Traps

ZmskieJrXm0UXvlN.description: This satchel includes 50 feet of rope, pulleys, a dozen pitons, a hammer, a grappling hook, and one set of crampons. Climbing kits allow you to attach yourself to the wall you're Climbing, moving half as quickly as usual (minimum 5 feet) but letting you attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:5] whenever you critically fail to prevent a fall. A single kit has only enough materials for one climber; each climber needs their own kit.

bxR6MLnxQmv3Z1uU.description:
Activate 1 Interact

After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in darkness. You gain darkvision for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.7UL8belWmo7U5YGM]{Effect: Darkvision Elixir (Lesser)}

oyLs9IU59COlK4uA.description:
You need thieves' tools to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types) using the Thievery skill.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Sw7MBLASN3xK4Y44]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action.
oyLs9IU59COlK4uA.name: Thieves' Tools

uNrr7RkSKbYzH11p.description: Yorulu isn't off-guard to creatures of 4th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking, or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.w6rMqmGzhUahdnA7]{Surprise Attack}.
uNrr7RkSKbYzH11p.name: Deny Advantage

Yorulu.name: Yorulu
Yorulu.npcAllSaves: +1 circumstance to all saves vs. traps
